If faithful sons and daughters of good family wish to know the noble eight precepts, they should be taught to say thus:

'Just like an arhat, for one's whole life one does not kill living beings, nor does one instruct others to kill, with a mind free from resentment, one should have a sense of shame, and have a compassionate mind for all sentient beings.

My name is so-and-so, and I have been taught by the arhats. From today onwards, I will no longer kill wantonly, harbor resentment, or be without a sense of shame. I will have a compassionate heart and pity all sentient beings.
Just like the arhats, I will not steal throughout my life, and will delight in giving. I will also not teach others to steal, and will always enjoy secluded places.
Thus, my name is so-and-so, and I have been taught by the arhats. I will no longer steal wantonly from today onwards, will always be generous, and will enjoy living in seclusion.
Just like the arhats, I will not engage in impure conduct throughout my life, but will always cultivate pure conduct, being pure and undefiled, and take pleasure in it.
Thus, my name is so-and-so, and I have been taught by the arhats. From now on, I will no longer engage in sexual misconduct, and will be pure and undefiled.
Just like the arhats, I will not speak falsely throughout my life, but will always be truthful. This is the most revered and most honorable, and is cherished by all the venerable elders in the world.

Thus, I, named so-and-so, have been taught by that arhat. From now on, I will never again tell lies, nor will I teach others to practice lying. I will be truthful, just as the World-Honored One never tells lies.
Just as the arhat does not drink alcohol, so I, named so-and-so, from now on will not drink alcohol as I wish, nor will I teach others to drink alcohol.
Just as the arhat does not violate the precepts for the rest of his life, but eats at the proper time,
so I, named so-and-so, for this one day and one night will not violate the precepts as I wish, nor will I teach others to violate the precepts, but will eat at the proper time.
Just as the arhat does not sit on high and luxurious beds for the rest of his life,
so I, named so-and-so, for this one day and one night will not sit on high and wide beds, nor will I teach others to sit on them.
It is just like an arhat who, for the duration of his life, does not engage in singing, dancing, or entertainment, and does not adorn himself with patterns, fragrances, or ointments.
Now, for this one day and one night, he does not engage in singing, dancing, or entertainment, and does not adorn himself with patterns, fragrances, or ointments.
